block.p: Here are the 10 streets, corners or squares approved by the City Council in 1993 to pay tribute to certain individuals. ALVIN AILEY PLACE, West 61st Street between West End and Amsterdam Avenues. Founded the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater in 1968 on West 61st Street.

Here are the 10 streets, corners or squares approved by the City Council in 1993 to pay tribute to certain individuals. ALVIN AILEY PLACE, West 61st Street between West End and Amsterdam Avenues. Founded the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater in 1968 on West 61st Street.

SHONA BAILEY PLACE, West 135th Street between Broadway and Riverside Drive. Aspiring actress and Girl Scout leader, murdered at age 21 in 1991 at her home on 135th Street. LEONARD BERNSTEIN PLACE, West 65th Street between Broadway and Amsterdam Avenue. Composer, conductor and music director from 1958 to 1969 of the New York Philharmonic, based at Lincoln Center. MARY MCLEOD BETHUNE PLACE, West 134th Street between Adam Clayton Powell Jr. and Frederick Douglass Boulevards, where P.S. 92, which requested the designation, is located. Founded the National Conference of Negro Women in 1935. CUS D'AMATO WAY, South Side of 14th Street between Fourth Avenue and Irving Place. Taught boxing for 50 years to the likes of Floyd Patterson, Jose Torres and Mike Tyson at the Gramercy Gym on 14th Street. LEON DAVIS STREET, West 43rd Street Between Eight and Ninth Avenues. In the 50's organized hospital workers, whose Local 1199 has headquarters on West 43rd. LOUIS DE SALVIO CORNER, southwest corner of Hester and Baxter Streets. State Assemblyman in the 1970's from the 62d District, which covers this area. JOHN MCKEAN SQUARE, corner of 43d Street and Tudor City Place. Real estate executive who retired in the early 70's to become a tenants rights advocate at Tudor City. MARGARET SANGER SQUARE, corner of Bleecker and Mott Streets. Founded in 1929 the Margaret Sanger Research Bureau, later part of Planned Parenthood of New York, at 26 Bleecker Street. ISAAC BASHEVIS SINGER BOULDEVARD, 86th Street between Broadway and Amsterdam Avenue. Winner of the 1978 Nobel Prize in Literature, who lived here much of his life. NEIGHBORHOOD REPORT: HONORIFIC STREET NAMES
